授業目的: This course introduces students to the social and cultural study of the modern Japanese environment. Examining aspects of both natural and built environments, this course provides a general understanding of the cultural constructions and technological interventions by which the Japanese have shaped the form and meaning of their archipelago.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a general understanding of the main concepts and approaches for analyzing the Japanese environment as a product of human cultural, social, and technological undertaking.
授業方法: Face to face format. Lectures, presentations, writing assignments. Zoom lessons for students who have received permission to study online.
